DOC.detailed_description: Intraoperative blood glucose level maintain target range 90—110 mg/dL ( euglycemia ) use protocol . The target serum glucose range choose ( 90-110 mg/dL ) choose specifically target level associate best outcome cerebral aneurysm surgery ( serum glucose < 108 mg/dL ) aggressively avoid level associate cognitive dysfunction ( serum glucose < 128 mg/dL ) gross neurologic deficit ( serum glucose < 152 mg/dL ) . Because strength data , investigator utilize aggressive insulin protocol routine clinical care patient undergoing craniotomy . Each patient randomly assign one two frequency intervention groups—Group 30 insulin dose adjust every 30 minute Group 60 insulin dose adjust every 60 minute . Blood glucose level , insulin bolus infusion rate , dextrose bolus record respective Intraoperative Insulin & Glucose data sheet ( Appendix 2 3 Group 30 Group 60 , respectively ) . Regardless protocol , glucose measurement conduct every 15 minute insulin intervention do 30 minute one hour ( per assign treatment group ) . The interval data ( 15 minute 30 min group 15 , 30 , 45 minute 1 hour group ) utilize determine pharmacodynamic effect insulin ( dose-response relationship ) . Interventions perform assigned interval ( 30 vs 60 min ) unless glucose level < 70 mg/dL , time patient receive 25 mL 50 % Dextrose solution . For rescued patient , protocol continue schedule . On day surgery , confirm entry study ( i.e. , confirmation research consent ) , patient randomly assign specific protocol—q 30 minute glucose measurement intervention vs. q 60 minute glucose measurement intervention.Randomization perform block 10 use computer generate random number assignment ( odd number = q 30 minute even number = q 60 minute )
DOC.criteria: All English speaking , nondiabetic , nonpregnant patient age 18 undergoing open craniotomy surgical treatment tumor intracranial aneurysm . Patients 18 year age , patient pregnant , patient diabetes , BMI > 33 kg/m2 .
